alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 6:53AM CST until November 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE SNOWBELT LATE TODAY INTO FRIDAY MORNING... .Occasional light snow and flurries will continue today. Heavier lake-effect snow showers will begin to affect the area during the late afternoon hours, continue overnight, and then diminish Friday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow showers. A total snow accumulation ranging from of 3 to 6 inches in the snowbelt of northern Vilas county... to a couple inches in the Eagle River area. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An intense snow band with snowfall rates of over one inch per hour is likely to be embedded within the larger area of lake-effect snow showers. The best estimate is that the band will primarily affect areas north and west of Vilas county. However, anyone with travel plans tonight or Friday morning should closely monitor later forecasts, because snowfall totals will need to be increased substantially if the band sets up farther southeast and lingers over Vilas county.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
